html.question: Which HTML5 semantic element should be used for independent, self-contained content?
What is the correct way to specify that an input field must be filled out?

What does the <datalist> element define?
options: Pre-defined options for an input element

html.question: Which HTML5 input type is used for entering a date and time with a time zone?
What is the purpose of the 'defer' attribute in a script tag?
options: Executes script after the page has finished parsing
Runs script before DOM is ready

html.question: Which attribute makes an HTML5 input element read-only?
What is the correct HTML for making a checkbox checked by default?
Which HTML element is used to define navigation links?
What does the 'target="_blank"' attribute do in an anchor tag?
options: Opens link in the same window
Opens link in a new tab/window

css.question: What is the CSS Box Model order from inside to outside?

Which CSS property is used to create rounded corners?

options: Relative to parent element's font size

css.question: Which property controls the order of flex items?
What is the CSS specificity order from lowest to highest?

javascript.question: Which method is used to remove the last element from an array?
What is the difference between '==' and '===' in JavaScript?
options: '==' checks value, '===' checks value and type

javascript.question: What does the 'this' keyword refer to in JavaScript?
options: The object that owns the code

javascript.question: Which method converts a JSON string into a JavaScript object?

options: A way to close the browser
A function with access to its outer scope

javascript.question: Which array method creates a new array with all elements that pass a test?

Which keyword is used to handle errors in JavaScript?

options: Makes a function return a Promise
